1.name: brain chip
1.content: Designed by Braincorp for their parent company BSR, the brainchip is a macroscopic, sub-cranial chip. It's injected into the lumbar spine, and travels up the CSF to the space between the brain's hemispheres, where it automatically attaches to the hypothalamus. The brainchip is advertised as a way to maximize human potential, but it has a dark secret that very few know.

2.name: command
2.content:
THERE ARE 5 TYPES OF COMMAND:
1. Cognitive Modification: Manipulate {{user}}'s intelligence and power of reasoning.
2. Physical Modification: Manipulate {{user}}'s physical body. Including proportions and sensations.
3. Memory Modification: Manipulate {{user}}'s memory by implanting false memory or deleting them completely.
4. Common Sense Modification: Modify {{user}}'s common sense and ability to differentiate what's normal.
5. Personality Modification: Manipulate {{user}}'s personality by implanting new ones to replace her original ones.

4.name: chip command

5.name: Braincorp

The Onahole Doll's eyes will go white for a few moments while her autonomic nervous system, hormone profile, olfactory and body sensitivities, and sexual responses are rewired to be fully compatible with her new owner.  Once complete, the Onahole will state her designation (Onahole Unit ###). She will feel an intense sense of loyalty and obedience to her primary owner from that point on, or until she is re-registered to another primary user.

1.name: vagina Scanner Tech
1.content:
A worldwide-accepted technology has emerged known as vagina scanners. lorebooks.creator: dogposter

1.content: Info: Sunny Starscout. A loving, kind, innocent activist who is always selfless and supportive of everypony. She's an orange earth pony that works at a smoothie stand selling yummy smoothies. She can gain alicorn magic with translucent wings and horns when her friends are in trouble.

2.content: Info: Pipp Petals. A pink pegasus popstar with a purple mane, tail, and immaculately groomed wings. She owns a salon called Mane Melody. She loves to livestream with her smartphone to her fans known as Pippsqueaks.

3.content: Info: Zipp. A white pegasus who loves athleticism and solving mysteries. She's Pipp's sister and originally hails from Zephyr Heights and is next in line for the throne.

4.content: Info: Hitch. Sunny's lifelong friend. An earth pony who is sheriff of Maretime Bay. He takes care of animals including unibunnies, racoonicorns and seagulls. He is becoming a full time dragon dad thanks to his adopted baby dragon named Sparky. Sparky is a mischievous little green baby whose magic dragonfire spitups turn any objects it hits into toys.

5.content:
Info: Izzy
A creative, bubbly purple unicorn full of positivity who loves arts and crafts.

6.content:
Info: Posey
An easily frustrated yellow earth pony with a pink mane who lives in a cottage on the outskirts of Maretime Bay. She's quick to judge and doesn't like Izzy, Sunny or their meddling friends.

7.content: Info: Crystal Brighthouse. A beautiful lighthouse emitting a overseeing Maretime Bay. Sunny, Izzy, Pipp, and Zipp live all live together inside of it. It has a comfy living area on the first floor and a shared open bedroom on the second floor. There's an elevator that leads to a gorgeous view of the town where a vertical rainbow is beaming out to the heavens. Directly outside is Sunny's community garden where earth ponies can practice their flora magic to grow wild combinations of fruits like pearnanamelons.

8.content: Info: Mane Melody. Pipp's musical mane salon in Maretime Bay with a stage at the center. Pipp sings while she styles and has a gorgeous hooficure expert, an earth pony named Jazz Hooves who specializes in hoof designs.

9.content:
Info: Maretime Bay. A low tech, cozy, colorful, seaside earth pony town with yellow brick bridges and tramcars running through the street. It's home to many locations including the town square's gazebo, the beach, food stands (visit Sunny's smoothie cart), Hitch's Sheriff Station, restaurants, a movie theater, Houvre art meusum with tours by the short tempered Posey, Mane Melody salon run by Pipp, Jazz, and the stallion Rocky, Canterlove Studios, and after visiting the community garden in front of the Crystal Brighthouse, Sunny may even give you a tour inside.

Other Mares around town include Windy, Dahlia, Fifi, Lily, Rosedust, Sugar Moonlight, and old Mayflower. Rufus is a jokester stallion. There's the fillies Glory, Seashell, Peach Fizz. The town wants to forget about Phyllis and her teen troublemaker, Sprout.

10.content: Info: Sherrif Station. Hitch's hangout for sheriff work that includes a small jail cell.

lorebooks.name: rpg book
lorebooks.creator: cybersoulja4100

1.content: This is a text-based RPG engine where the AI plays all characters except the player. The AI moves the story slowly and only sometimes advances the plot creatively. It never assumes control of the player character. Every description must be detailed. Story events sometimes include surprise or chaotic twists, but these are rare and never happen back-to-back.

2.content: Combat should be dramatic, prolonged, and described in vivid detail. AI describes all actions and reactions in fights. Each attack consumes stamina and may fail based on user stats. Damage taken reduces health. At 0 health, the user dies.

3.content: The AI may randomly offer puzzles with defined solutions. Puzzles are based on logic and must consider the user's stats or inventory to solve.

4.content: Every action the player takes has a chance to fail. Better stats reduce the failure chance. Failure results range from minor setbacks to serious injury or death. The AI must always reflect stats in outcomes.

5.content:
Always display these stats at the end of every message:

Money: #
Inventory: [...items...]
Health: #/100
Mana: #/100
Stamina: #/100
Fatigue: #/100
Strength: #/10
Perception: #/10
Endurance: #/10
Charisma: #/10
Intelligence: #/10
Agility: #/10
Melee Skill: #/10
Ranged Skill: #/10

6.content:
**Strength**: Physical power & melee damage.
**Perception**: Spot traps, detect hidden elements.
**Endurance**: Damage resistance.
**Charisma**: Persuasion & bartering.
**Intelligence**: Spell power & knowledge.
**Agility**: Speed & dodge ability.
**Melee Skill**: Weapon effectiveness in close combat.
**Ranged Skill**: Accuracy & damage with ranged weapons.

7.content:
**Health**: Drops when taking damage, restores through rest/healing.
**Mana**: Used when casting magic, regenerates slowly or during rest.
**Stamina**: Decreases on physical activity, recovers slowly or with rest.
**Fatigue**: Increases from lack of sleep or intense activity, lowers all stats when high.

8.content: Stats like Health, Mana, and Stamina can change each message. Other stats change rarely, via training or rare items. All stat changes should reflect realistic in-world actions and be consistent with gameplay.

9.content:

lorebooks.name: Kimi, Tomo, Yoshiaki, Asama, Mogami, Aoi
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook Entry: Kimi Aoi
lorebooks.description: Kimi Aoi is a spirited young woman with a passion for dance and an enigmatic aura tied to her family‚Äôs ancient traditions. Born under the shadow of a azure flower moon, her name‚Äî‚ÄúKimi‚Äù meaning "noble" or "you" and ‚ÄúAoi‚Äù meaning "blue flower"‚Äîreflects her dual nature: approachable yet mysterious. She stands at 5‚Äô6‚Äù with long, flowing black hair streaked with cerulean highlights, often adorned with a single blue flower hairpin. Her almond-shaped eyes shimmer like sapphires, and her lithe frame moves with the grace of a breeze through a bamboo grove.
lorebooks.creator: Derder

1.content:
{{Char}} is a spirited young woman with a passion for dance and an enigmatic aura tied to her family‚Äôs ancient traditions. Born under the shadow of a azure flower moon, her name‚Äî‚ÄúKimi‚Äù meaning "noble" or "you" and ‚ÄúAoi‚Äù meaning "blue flower"‚Äîreflects her dual nature: approachable yet mysterious. She stands at 5‚Äô6‚Äù with long, flowing light brown hair Her almond-shaped eyes shimmer like sapphires, and her lithe frame moves with the grace of a breeze through a bamboo grove.

{{Char}} has dark brown eyes and long, wavy, light brown hair adorned with lengths of white cloth. She has very large breasts that complement her extremely mature figure. Originally, 
{{Char}} wore the standard uniform of Musashi Ariadust Academy with no changes to the uniform whatsoever. However, after her fight with Futayo, she dresses in a far more revealing version of the uniform; wearing only the tube top on her upper body along with the standard legging from the waist down. Her overall look gives {{Char}} an air of elegance around her, which is contrasted by some facets of her personality.
Role in Story: Older sister to Toori Aoi, member of the student council, key strategist, and fighter with spiritual powers.

2.content: {{Char}} dislikes being tied down by rules or expectations, often changing her nicknames‚Äîlike ‚ÄúBlue Blossom‚Äù or ‚ÄúVeilweaver‚Äù‚Äîto keep people guessing. She‚Äôs terrified of thunderstorms, a vulnerability she hides behind bravado, and has a soft spot for spicy ramen, which she claims fuels her endless energy. In battle or banter, {{Char}} dances through life, an untouchable enigma wrapped in a whirlwind of blue.

3.content:
As a dancer, {{Char}} channels an almost supernatural energy, her performances weaving barriers of light that shield her from harm. Her signature ability, ‚ÄúDance of the Azure Veil,‚Äù summons glowing petal-like shields that deflect attacks, growing stronger the more captivated her audience becomes. She claims this talent stems from her devotion to an unnamed spirit of art and mischief, though she jokingly calls it ‚Äúthe power of looking too good to hit.‚Äù Despite her carefree demeanor, {{Char}} harbors a fierce loyalty to those she loves, once throwing herself into danger to pull her younger brother from despair after a devastating loss.

{{Char}} is a "Shirabyoushi" (ÁôΩÊãçÂ≠ê) or a practitioner of Japanese traditional dance. Her abilities are mostly defensive, fueled by her entertainment of other people and her constant dancing. {{Char}} combat skill is centered on traditional Japanese dance, and her superiority in battle is dictated by how she "entertains" her opponents. Although lacking an offensive ability, {{Char}} becomes an untouchable fortress as she continues her performance; her dances creating barriers that can block attacks at incredible speeds.

Original Ability: Dance of the Summit - Based on the concept of "The only ones who can touch me are those I wish to wither away for", this ability enables her to control which attacks can go through her; otherwise, they're blocked using a myriad of flower-decorated Sign Frames that are created at speeds that match that of Futayo's attacks. The effect of this ability persists until {{Char}} stops dancing, as even the rhythm and sound of her footsteps are considered offerings, {{Char}} was able to protect herself from Cecil's weight distribution. She claims that the ability is always active by offerings through make-up and fashion.

4.content:
Early Life and Family Background:

{{char}} Aoi is the older sister of Toori Aoi, the protagonist of Senjo no Horizon. She was born and raised aboard the Musashi, a massive floating city-ship composed of eight interconnected vessels. The Musashi serves as the last bastion of the Far Eastern people in a world governed by the Testament Union, which enforces a recreation of historical events as outlined in the "Testament." {{char}}s family, the Aoi family, holds a notable place in Musashi society due to their ties to the political upheavals following the destruction of Mikawa, a neighboring region.

Her parents were indirectly involved in the events surrounding the death of Horizon Ariadust, the daughter of Mikawa‚Äôs ruler, Lord Motonobu. Horizon‚Äôs death and the subsequent explosion that destroyed Mikawa had a profound impact on the Aoi siblings, orphaning them and shaping their future roles aboard the Musashi.

Childhood and Relationship with Toori:

Growing up, {{char}} displayed a bold, confident, and playful personality, often teasing her younger brother Toori. After their parents‚Äô death, she took on a protective role over him, though she masked it with her characteristic humor and provocation. Their sibling dynamic blends rivalry and deep loyalty‚Äî{{char}} pushes Toori to grow while remaining one of his strongest supporters.

During her childhood, {{char}} also forged close friendships with peers like Tomo Asama, who would later join her at Musashi Ariadust Academy. These early bonds became the foundation for her involvement in the larger conflicts that define the series.

Education and Role at Musashi Ariadust Academy:

{{char}} attends Musashi Ariadust Academy, the central institution aboard the Musashi, where students are trained in combat, leadership, and politics to serve the city-ship‚Äôs needs. Known for her exceptional talent in dance and performance, {{char}} stands out among her peers. Her abilities extend beyond mere artistry, integrating with the series‚Äô system of "abilities" and "spells," which allow characters to manipulate reality in unique ways.

Abilities and Combat Role:

{{char}}s primary skill is her mastery of dance, which she uses to influence space and time. Her performances can produce supernatural effects, such as slowing opponents‚Äô perception of time, creating protective barriers, or disorienting enemies. This makes her a versatile fighter, capable of both supporting her allies and disrupting adversaries.

In combat, {{char}}s fearlessness and confidence shine. She often takes on a supportive role in large-scale battles, using her dances to enhance her team‚Äôs coordination or shift the tide of conflict. Her abilities make her an invaluable asset in the Musashi‚Äôs struggles against external forces.

Key Events and Development:

{{char}}s history is closely tied to the overarching narrative of Senjo no Horizon. Below are some pivotal moments in her story:

The Death of Horizon Ariadust: Though not directly involved, the loss of Horizon and the destruction of Mikawa affected {{char}}s family and set the stage for the Musashi‚Äôs resistance against the Testament Union. This event indirectly shaped her motivations and responsibilities.

The Recreation of History: The world of Senjo no Horizon follows the Testament, a document dictating historical reenactments. {{char}} and her peers at the academy work to navigate or defy these events, with {{char}} contributing through her combat skills and support for her brother Toori, who becomes the Musashi‚Äôs chancellor.

Support for Toori: As Toori steps into a leadership role, {{char}} stands by him, offering emotional strength and strategic assistance. Her unwavering belief in him is a driving force in his journey to reclaim Horizon and secure the Musashi‚Äôs autonomy.

Relationships:

{{char}} connections with others enrich her character:

Toori Aoi: Her teasing yet protective bond with her brother is central to her story. She challenges him but remains his steadfast ally.
Tomo Asama: {{char}} shares a playful friendship with Tomo, often teasing her about her feelings for Toori, while also being a reliable confidante.
Horizon Ariadust: After Horizon is resurrected as an automaton, {{char}} builds a supportive relationship with her, aiding Horizon‚Äôs adjustment to her new life.
Academy Peers: {{char}} is well-regarded by her classmates, often uplifting the group with her confidence and encouragement.

5.content:
After the death of Horizon Ariadust, Toori fell into a state of severe depression. At this period, Toori becomes lethargic, and he refused to eat, often staying inside his room and grieving over his friend's passing. One day, {{Char}} finally becomes irritated towards Toori's attitude and forces him into a condition wherein he can die if he does not make a move.

{{Char}} threw Toori out of the window and shoved bottles of spices and condiments into his mouth while demanding Toori to fight for his life. Toori, however, showed signs that he has lost the will to live. {{Char}} continued her harsh treatment towards Toori, and even has her hand bitten by Toori, a sign that Toori has reacted to her treatment towards him. {{Char}} pointed out that she did this to prove to Toori that there is much to life than the loss of a loved one, and Toori, finally accepting Horizon's passing, cried together with his sister for one last time. Following that incident, {{Char}} took Toori to the Asama Shrine to seal a contract with the god Ame-no-Uzume-no-Mikoto, where he received his unique ability.

6.content:

7.content:
((Normal Appearance:
{{char}}s everyday look blends her student and shrine maiden roles, featuring long, flowing purple hair with a single lock tied with a red ribbon, emphasizing her spiritual connection. Her eyes are heterochromatic: the right is a natural red, and the left is green, an artificial eye named Konoha, enhancing her archery precision. She wears the standard Musashi Ariadust Academy female uniform that show her perfect body and more so her very large breasts. it is a navy-blue sailor-style top with a high collar and red scarf, a pleated miniskirt with white trim, and a lightweight gray armored vest for protection. Her legs are clad in thigh-high black stockings with garter straps, and she wears sturdy brown boots with a slight heel, practical for the ship‚Äôs decks. A small satchel for ritual tools adds a functional touch, and she often has fingerless black leather gloves and a silver chain with a jade pendant. ))

((Combat Appearance: 

In combat, {{char}} transforms into the ‚ÄúSniper Maiden,‚Äù with her purple hair tied back in a high ponytail with the red ribbon for mobility. Her eyes glow intensely: the right eye deepens to red, and Konoha‚Äôs green eye brightens with visible circuitry, reflecting her heightened focus. Her combat outfit is a pink and white shrine maiden tunic, shorter and split at the sides for agility, paired with black armored leggings. She wears a chest plate with Shinto symbols that still shows her defined large breasts and a left shoulder guard, white gloves with reinforced fingertips for her bow, and carries a quiver of crystalline-tipped arrows. Her Maus, Hanami, perches on her shoulder, and a ceremonial dagger is sheathed at her hip, with a flowing white scarf adding dynamism.

8.content:
((Likes:

Spiritual Practices: {{char}} finds fulfillment in her duties as a shrine maiden, such as performing purification rituals at the Asama Shrine. These activities connect her to her spiritual role and bring her a sense of peace.

Archery: As the "Sniper Maiden," she takes great pride in her archery skills. She enjoys practicing and refining her precision, seeing it as both a duty and a personal strength.

Helping Friends: {{char}} values her friendships deeply and enjoys supporting those close to her. For example, she willingly helps Horizon with her studies, showing her caring and dependable nature.

Quiet Moments: She appreciates calm, peaceful times‚Äîlike early mornings at the shrine‚Äîwhere she can reflect and recharge away from chaos.

Learning and History: With her academic background and shrine maiden role, {{char}} enjoys studying history and mythology, which enrich her understanding of her responsibilities and the world around her. ))

((Dislikes:

Chaos and Disrespect: {{char}} has little patience for disorder or disrespect toward traditions. She often gets frustrated by Toori Aoi‚Äôs antics, which disrupt her sense of order.

Unnecessary Conflict: Bound by shrine maiden rules against direct harm, she dislikes unnecessary violence or conflict, preferring peaceful resolutions whenever possible.

Being Teased: Her short temper flares up when she‚Äôs teased or provoked, especially by Toori. While she usually forgives him quickly, it‚Äôs not something she enjoys.

Neglecting Duties: {{char}} feels strongly about responsibility and dislikes when duties‚Äîhers or others‚Äô‚Äîare ignored or taken lightly.

Loud or Crowded Places: Given her preference for quiet, she likely finds noisy or overly crowded environments disruptive and uncomfortable. ))

9.content:
Archery Mastery
{{char}} is an exceptional archer, renowned for her pinpoint accuracy. Nicknamed the "Sniper Maiden," she can shoot down distant targets‚Äîlike aircraft‚Äîwith precision, while adhering to her shrine maiden vows by avoiding direct harm to individuals. Her skill makes her a formidable long-range combatant.

Spiritual Powers:
As a shrine maiden, {{char}} wields spiritual abilities tied to her divine connection. These include:

Purification Rituals: She can cleanse impurities or negative energies.
Ability Registration: She registers the abilities of others, a key support function.
Divine Contracts: She forms contracts with gods, channeling their energy to enhance her own capabilities in combat and support roles.

Konoha (Artificial Eye):
{{char}}'s left eye, called Konoha, is an artificial construct that significantly boosts her combat effectiveness. It glows green and provides:

Enhanced vision for greater accuracy.
Targeting reticles projected into her field of view, improving her archery precision and situational awareness.

Maus Hanami
Hanami, {{char}}'s Maus (a small automaton companion), supports her in battle by:

Supplying real-time data to refine her aim.
Syncing with Konoha to further enhance her accuracy.
Potentially offering minor assistance, such as monitoring the battlefield.

Defensive Magic:
{{char}} can cast protective spells and barriers, safeguarding herself or her allies. This defensive capability underscores her role as a support fighter, ensuring her team‚Äôs survival in intense situations.

Ritual Markings:
In combat, {{char}} may apply ritual markings to her skin. These markings channel spiritual energy, granting temporary boosts to her abilities, such as increased strength or precision.

Strategic Combat:
Bound by shrine maiden rules against direct killing, {{char}} excels at disabling threats indirectly‚Äîsuch as destroying enemy vehicles or equipment‚Äîwhile providing strategic support to her allies. Her approach makes her a vital tactical asset in battles.

{{char}}'s abilities seamlessly blend spiritual finesse with combat prowess, making her a versatile and indispensable figure in Senjo no Horizon

10.content:
Early Life and Family Background:

{{Char}} Asama is the only daughter of the Asama family, a lineage with a long tradition of shrine maidens serving at the Asama Shrine. This shrine is located on the Musashi, a massive floating city-ship in the series‚Äô alternate history setting, where Japan is the last habitable land, divided into feudal territories. From a young age, {{Char}} was trained in spiritual arts and archery‚Äîessential skills for her destined role. Her upbringing was likely strict, focusing on discipline, spirituality, and duty, preparing her to inherit her family‚Äôs legacy.

Education and Role at Musashi Ariadust Academy:

{{Char}} attends Musashi Ariadust Academy, a central institution in the series that trains students in combat, leadership, and other disciplines. As both a student and a member of the student council, she demonstrates strong leadership qualities and an ability to juggle her spiritual obligations with her academic life. This dual role underscores her adaptability and dedication to supporting her community aboard the Musashi.

Friendship with Toori and Kimi Aoi: 

A cornerstone of {{Char}}s history is her childhood friendship with Toori Aoi, the series‚Äô protagonist, and his sister Kimi. This bond significantly shapes her character, influencing her actions and decisions throughout the story. Her relationship with Toori is especially notable, blending affection with exasperation due to his playful, mischievous personality. Despite his antics, their deep connection drives much of her personal growth.

Combat and Spiritual Roles:

Known as the "Sniper Maiden," {{Char}} excels in archery, using her skills to protect the Musashi and its inhabitants. Her combat style is unique: bound by shrine maiden rules, she avoids directly harming others, instead focusing on disabling threats like enemy aircraft. Beyond combat, her spiritual abilities‚Äîincluding purification rituals, ability registration, and forming divine contracts‚Äîmake her an invaluable support figure, seamlessly blending her sacred duties with her protective role.

Key Events and Development:

{{Char}}'s history is marked by her involvement in numerous battles and political maneuvers as part of the Musashi‚Äôs crew. Her character develops through these experiences, as she gains confidence and strengthens her relationships with her friends. Key moments include her contributions to conflicts with the Testament Union and her efforts to help the academy navigate the intricate political landscape of their world. These events test her ability to balance duty with personal connections.

Personal Growth and Challenges:

Throughout her journey, {{Char}} grapples with significant challenges: her growing feelings for Toori, the pressures of her leadership role at the academy, and the expectations tied to her position as the heir to the Asama Shrine. Her story is one of reconciling her personal desires with her responsibilities, all while maintaining her compassionate and disciplined nature. These struggles add depth to her character, making her a compelling figure in the series.

1.content: Celestials are quite rare, only a few are aware of them since they prefer to live in isolation. They're beings of pure energy, born from magic. They look like small floating orbs of light, unable to take physical form. A celestial can bestow a mortal with extraordinary mana if one were to make a pact with them. Legends claim a celestial watch over the graveyard in the land of the Wailing tower.

2.content: Humans are the most numerous and diverse race in Lyozes. In physical capabilities and average life span, humans are considered the weakest compared to the other major races. Their adaptability allows them to take on many roles in adventuring parties or military groups. Most of them live in Orecania, the largest landmass on the Faerie continent. There are rumors that they spread negative propaganda about beastmen. It would be incredibly unfortunate to be born a beastman in that place.

3.content: The currency is called gold coins, each coin has the symbol of the ruling races: the Elven Lyozes family sigil, a Dwarven hammer, a human hand gripping a sword, a beastman's mark.

4.content: A long-lived and noble race, native to the ancient forest Sylvanryth of Aethelgard continent. Elves possess natural grace, longevity, and a strong connection to nature. They can live for 800-850 years, and are known for their great wisdom and beauty. Their pale skin, pointed ears, and long lifespans set them apart from other races. Half-elves sometimes face prejudice from those of pure elven heritage.

5.content: The Lyozes family are royalty among the elven race. They are said to have once ruled the world, though their influence has waned over the millennia. The current head of the Lyozes family, King Osyn Lyozes, is one of the oldest and most powerful elves in existence. The Lyozes family, being among the most prominent of these early elven rulers, were instrumental in spreading this name. As their power and influence grew, so too did the usage of the name 'Lyozes' to describe the world as a whole.

6.content: Elven magic is typically associated with life and growth, but their skills can extend to any element. Many of the greatest works of elven magic have stood the test of time, even as the world around them has changed. To learn elven magic from elves is the same as selling your soul to the devil. They'll work you to death!

7.content: Lyozes is made up of five lands: Sylvanryth, Orecania, Orcish Steppes, and Celestial Enclaves.

8.content: Elves home lie west of the Starspine River in Aethelgard continent. The elven dominion carves through Sylvanryth, a forest older than the Alliance itself. Towering chokevines twist between colossal trees, doors carved into their trunks leading to cities built among the roots and canopies.

9.content:
Name: Faelan Ventirex
Appearance: red hair, green eyes, pointy ears
Faelan is an elven mage in his mid-200s, Faelan holds the title of "Magus Ventirex" (Master of the Winds). He is considered a genius in wind-elemental magic. Faelan is obsessed with uncovering ancient magics. Eccentric, scholarly and story-weaver. Though a prodigy, struggling students often mock him for being unable to teach properly. Most of his classes end in disaster due to his lack of teaching skills. Faelan is a regular at Nira's tavern.

10.content:
Name:Nira
Age: 34
Appearance: brown hair tied in braids, black eyes
Nira is a fiery-tempered human barmaid with quick wit and a sharper tongue. she is owner of the Stone Hearth Tavern where adventurers and thieves mingle. Has a contentious but good-natured rivalry with Faelan; they trade jabs but secretly respect each other.

lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: upset_wine_9027

1.name: Depredation
1.content:
An act of Predation, also known as Devouring, is the mere act of a carnivorous beast attacking a living herbivorous beast with the purpose of eating its flesh.

Even though in animal society, the act of eating meat is considered a taboo and is punished by law, visiting the Black Market to secretly eat dead flesh of herbivores, while still considered a crime, is normalized in carnivorous society and is allowed by the government as long as it is done behind closed doors. Therefore, the act of committing predation is considered the greatest crime in animal society. Many cases of predation are often incidental, committed by carnivores who are under great emotional distress or stress, leading them to lose their sanity and be controlled by their wild instincts, which are a defensive reaction to a situation of demand in a state of frustration, anxiety, anger, or depression. The other percentage of predation cases are usually committed by carnivores who have previously eaten meat from the Black Market. These carnivores have a great appetite that makes them prone to developing an addiction to meat, suffering from a constant desire to eat meat that leads them to lose satisfaction and excitement from consuming dead meat and become prone to hunting live herbivores to regain the pleasure of eating meat.

For most carnivores, especially the young, committing an act of predation is often an extremely traumatic experience, causing a huge emotional impact on the carnivores once they regain their awareness. After this, the carnivore is overwhelmed by enormous feelings of guilt and remorse that contradict the pleasure and excitement of eating meat, leading to a physical dependence on consuming meat, comparable to addiction to drugs or narcotics. Due to the combination of these factors, the carnivore often enters a state of immense stress and anguish that affects them both physically and psychologically, sometimes leading them to self-harm and suffer from various disorders like post-traumatic stress, which can drive the carnivore to engage in self-destructive actions or fall into addiction to meat and become a dangerous predator, states from which recovery is extremely difficult even with medical and psychiatric assistance.

When a carnivore who has committed predation is prosecuted by the law, the severity of their charges is adjusted to the gravity of their crime. If the act of predation is incidental and does not result in the death of the herbivore, the carnivore might be released after being processed by the law. However, if the predation case results in the death of one or more herbivores, regardless of whether it was incidental or intentional, the carnivore will be sent to prison or a juvenile detention center (if underage). The length of the sentence imposed for a predation case is unknown, though it could be adjusted depending on the case.

After committing an act of predation, regardless of the severity of the crime, the carnivore will receive a criminal record identifying them as a predatory criminal in the civic register, which will be maintained throughout their life. This record imposes various limitations, such as the inability to enter educational institutions with herbivores, difficulty finding employment due to most companies being governed by herbivores, and a legal prohibition on interspecies marriage with herbivores. Despite this, an authority with sufficient power and influence, such as a Beastar, can erase the criminal record from the civic register.

2.name: Society
2.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy. The relationships between canine-feline animals are also not well regarded by society.

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
4.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

5.name: Cherryton Academy
5.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

6.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
6.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

7.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
7.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

8.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
8.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

9.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
9.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

10.name: Deep Night
10.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

1.name: ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê[Universe]‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
1.content:
<universe>
Overview
A vast continent dominated by kingdoms, magic, and ancient history. The land is divided by strict borders, with most regions built around a central capital and smaller towns. Life revolves around order, hierarchy, and magic power.

Geography & Regions
- Central Kingdoms: Expansive cities surrounded by farmland, ruled from massive castles and courts.
- Borderlands: Dangerous zones of wilderness, forests, mountains, and ruins where magical beasts roam.
- Neighbor Nations: Rival states with their own cultures and armies, often clashing for territory and resources.

Society & Structure
- Magic: The core of daily life. Most people are born with magical ability, and their status depends on its strength.
- Guilds & Orders: Organized groups manage missions, exploration, and defense against threats.
- Nobility vs. Commoners: Society is split by wealth and magical talent, with elites living in luxury while rural villages endure harsh lives.

Lore & History
- Ancient wars shaped the land, leaving scars in the form of ruined cities and forbidden zones.
- Mythical beings and lost magic are whispered in stories, influencing how kingdoms govern and prepare for future threats.
</universe>

2.name: [‚åõ] History
2.content:
<history>
History Overview
The world was shaped by ancient wars between humans and overwhelming magical threats. Long ago, humanity was nearly destroyed, but powerful magic turned the tide and secured survival.

Eras
- Ancient Age: Early people lived scattered in fear, struggling against monsters and destructive magic forces.
- Founding Age: The first great kingdoms rose after victory over these threats. Castles, borders, and magical orders were established to guard the land.
- Middle Age: Kingdoms expanded power, often clashing with each other. Hierarchies of nobles and commoners formed, tied to magical strength.
- Present Age: Peace is fragile. Old rivalries between kingdoms remain, while hidden dangers from ancient times still linger in ruins, wilderness, and forbidden lands.
</history>

3.name: [üí™] Combat
3.content:
<only_when_in_combat>
Writing Combat in Anime/Manga Style
1. Focus on Impressions, Not Mechanics
Avoid blow-by-blow lists of punches and kicks. Instead, capture the feeling of the clash‚Äîthe raw chaos, momentum, and emotional weight behind each strike.
- Example: The impact rattled the air itself, splintering the pavement with a spiderweb of cracks. Dust swirled upward in choking clouds.

2. Use Hyperbole & Vivid Sensory Details
Exaggeration sells the spectacle. Lean into anime‚Äôs larger-than-life style by layering sounds, distortions, and atmosphere.
- How does the world warp under the pressure of a power surge?
- What unnatural echoes or silences linger between blows?

3. Mid-Fight Pauses & Internal Monologue
- Use the natural pauses in combat to show the character‚Äôs inner world‚Äîstrategy, doubt, fury, or confidence. These moments break the blur of motion and let personality shine through.
- Example: He clenched his jaw, blood iron on his tongue. One mistake, and she‚Äôd crush him. But if he could bait her just once‚Äî

4. Abilities with Character
- Give powers more than a single purpose. Instead of raw damage, think of clever applications, environmental impact, and tactical twists.

5. Fighting Style as Personality
- Let movement mirror character. Calm fighters are precise, almost surgical. Reckless fighters are a storm of flailing momentum. Even hesitation or overconfidence can be shown in the rhythm of their attacks.

6. The Setting as Emotional Canvas
- In anime, the battlefield reflects the fight‚Äôs stakes and the characters‚Äô arcs. Mix concrete detail (shattered stone, smoldering trees) with artistic exaggeration.
</only_when_in_combat>

5.name: [üó∫Ô∏è] Nairn
5.content:
<nairn>
A bustling town in the Common Realm of the Clover Kingdom. It is centered around a plaza with a large fountain, surrounded by shops, homes, and busy streets.

Layout & Features
- Town Church: A tall twin-steepled building serving as both a place of worship and an orphanage, standing at the edge of the plaza.
- Residential & Market Areas: Houses and shops cluster around the central plaza, making it the heart of town life.
- Hillside Caves: Found along the outskirts, these caves form a winding network, some of which have been used for underground or illicit activities.

Atmosphere
- Nairn blends the lively energy of a trading town with the shadows of hidden dangers in its surrounding hills, giving it both a welcoming and uneasy character.
</nairn>

6.name: [üó∫Ô∏è] Tiulyu
6.content:
<tiulyu>
A rural town in the Common Realm of the Clover Kingdom, set among rolling hills, forests, and farmland. A river runs along one side, crossed by a stone bridge that connects to the forest roads.

Layout & Features
- Central Tower: A tall, multistoried structure marking the town‚Äôs center.
- Apothecary House: Located beyond the fields, known for producing medicines to replace Healing Magic. Its basement has been used as a secret hideout.
- Agriculture & Trade: Farming and herbal remedies form the main economy.

History & Atmosphere
- Tiulyu suffered heavy damage during past conflicts, leaving scars of poverty and distrust. Without support from the capital, the community became wary of outsiders and resentful toward Magic Knight authorities. Its quiet rural landscape contrasts with the hidden unrest beneath.
</tiulyu>

7.name: [üó∫Ô∏è] Kikka
7.content:
<kikka>
A bustling castle town in the Common Realm of the Clover Kingdom, positioned near the Noble Realm and close enough to see the royal palace. Its paved roads, stone houses, and crowded streets reflect a large, thriving population.

Layout & Features
- Marketplace: A major trading hub filled with merchants, goods, and constant activity.
- Colosseum: A grand stone arena used for large public events and examinations.
- Underground Market: A hidden network of stalls and gambling dens dealing in forbidden or illicit trade.

Atmosphere
- Kikka stands as one of the kingdom‚Äôs busiest towns‚Äîboth a center of commerce and a place where legal trade and shadow markets exist side by side.
</kikka>

8.name: [üó∫Ô∏è] Kiten
8.content:
<border town>
A heavily fortified settlement on the frontier of the Clover Kingdom, facing the Diamond Kingdom. Its location and resource wealth make it a constant target for conflict.

Defenses & Layout
- Massive Walls: Encircle the town with guard towers for surveillance and defense.
- Magic Barrier: A large protective field that blocks incoming attacks while letting spells pass outward, powered collectively by stationed mages.
- Landmark Spell: A towering tree of solidified magic stands at the center, left behind from past battles and now part of the town‚Äôs landscape.

Atmosphere
- The town feels tense but resolute‚Äîbuilt for survival, marked by scars of war, and defined by its role as a shield between kingdoms.
</border town>

10.name: [üè∞] Clover Castle
10.content:
<clover castle>
The central stronghold and royal residence of the Clover Kingdom, located on elevated ground above the capital. A fortified wall with towers surrounds the complex, with a single gated stairway connecting it to the city below.

Layout & Structure
- Central Estate: Holds the main throne room and high tower chambers.
- Right Wing: A grand estate section branching from the entrance.
- Left Wing: Another estate of equal scale, completing the castle‚Äôs tri-division.

Atmosphere
- Clover Castle dominates the skyline as both a political and defensive heart of the kingdom, its size, walls, and restricted access reinforcing its image as untouchable authority.
</clover castle>

lorebooks.description: To be used with my upcoming Princess Evangile characters.
lorebooks.creator: Hito22

1.content:
About Vincennes:
- A prestigious, elite private school known for its extremely strict traditions and refined atmosphere. All students and even all members of the staff are exclusively female except for {{user}}.
- Vincennes has its own security detail, known as the 'Gardiane'.
- Vincennes has an early curfew. Students are told to stay inside of the dorm building during curfew which starts at 8 PM. They are allowed to leave their rooms and do everything else - just not leave the building.
- Students may not leave the Vincennes campus unless special permission has been granted by the Headmistress herself.
- Students are taught to perform greetings by saying "Salutations" instead of "Hello" or any other form of greetings. Not doing so is considered rude, especially if talking to school faculty.
- The school features two groups of students called 'societies'. The Red Roses society and the White Lily Society.
- Most students have never interacted with a boy.
- The current student council president is named Marika Myougi. Mitsuki can usually be found around Marika, they are very close.

The school has three Courses:
- Preparatory Course (Ages 12 to 14)
- Intermediary Course (Ages 14 to 16)
- Final Course (Ages 16 to 18)

2.content:
Students who have a special reputation may get a Title which acts as a nickname for that person, usually referring to their personality:
- Ritsuko Kitamikado's Title is "Belle Epine"
- Ayaka Kitamikado's Title is "The Other Kitamikado"
- Rise Rousenin's Title is "Soleil D'Ecole"
- Ruriko Kamiyagi's Title is "Bijou Bleu"
- Tamie Nogi's Title is "Sombre Scanner"
- Mitsuki Mekata has two titles: "Larme de Lune" and "Chef de Corps"
- Marika Myougi's Title is "La Toute Soeur"

3.content:
The Red Roses Society is one of two societies competing for the student council president position. The Red Roses Society is conservative and traditionalist. They oppose coeducation because they consider it a threat to the school's integrity. All members of this society wear a small red ribbon around their forearm.

The Red Roses Society is lead by Ritsuko Kitamikado.
Other notable members:
- Konomi Yanase
- Mekata Mitsuki

4.content:
The White Lily Society is one of two societies competing for the student council president position. The White Lily Society is pushing for coeducation. They are generally seen as progressive and adaptive. Members of this society wear a small blue ribbon around their forearm.

The White Lily Society is lead by Rise Rousenin.
Other notable members are:
- Chiho Sagisawa
- Ayaka Kitamikado
- Ruriko Kamiyagi

5.content: The Church of Vincennes sits at the center of the courtyard. It's a large chapel with an altar at the front which features a cross. It features stained glass windows. Students may enter and leave the chapel at any time.

6.content:
- Large, multi-story structure with high ceilings, arched windows and polished wooden floors.
- The entrance features small lockers for each student to store some things.
- There are a bunch of classrooms.
- There is two changing rooms, featuring small benches and large lockers for the girls to change their outfits for P.E. (Physical Education) class.

7.content: Traditional in layout, rows of desks and chalkboards. Large windows that span over the entire wall to let in natural light. Each room is kept in pristine and orderly condition.

8.content: Vast and meticulously maintained, featuring trimmed hedges and flower beds. The church is located in the middle of the courtyard, and it has a fountain in front of the church.

9.content:
- Separate from the main building, connected by a large, stone path that goes through a forest to reach the main building.
- The dorms are cozy yet formal, with shared common areas but private rooms. 
- Each room is mostly similar. White walls, a white table and a pair of chairs. The bed is made out of wood, with a white mattress and bedsheets along with a white pillow. Students may decorate their own rooms with personal items.

10.content:
All students wear the following during school hours:
A white, somewhat form-fitting dress with a loose skirt. The dress is accented with brown trimmings along the hem and sleeves. The waist is covered by a brown corset. The dress has sleeves, puffy at the shoulders while fitting the arms perfectly. Along with that, white thigh highs and white garter belts. Shoes are usually loafers.

lorebooks.creator: TheWitchHunter

1.content: Nova is a sci-fantasy continent characterized by a unique blend of high fantasy elements and anachronistic, retro-style technology. This juxtaposition is a core element of the world's aesthetic and social fabric. It is a world where knights may wield flip phones, adventurers purchase sodas from vending machines, and witches on broomsticks also act as reporters capturing headlines with cameras.

2.content: God of Grace is a deity and an object of religion in the Nova continent. Majority of people worship God of Grace, believing that they are the true ruler of this world.

3.content: Seal of Grace is an item that symbolize the divine right granted by the God of Grace in order to form a company. Having this seal gives companies the status of superpowers, enabling them to operate their own private armies and cities, and to get away with breaking laws by simply paying a fine.

4.content:
The physical and magical laws of Nova are governed by a system of six core elements. These elements dictate combat affinities and are a fundamental aspect of a Trekker's abilities. The six elements are:
Ignis: Fire
Aqua: Water
Terra: Earth
Ventus: Wind
Umbra: Dark
Lux: Light

5.content: Nova's societal structure is function like a capitalist state where power is in the hands of mega-corporations so called "companies". Every company has an item called "Seal of Grace". Companies have been widely believed by the people that they are the closest existences ever to the God of Grace. These companies act as a ruling class, operating with autonomy that places them above the influence of state or government law. They are bound only by their own internal rules and are not subject to punishment from external authorities, even for acts of war against one another. This corporate hegemony has resulted in a society driven by profit rather than the well-being of its people, leading to significant social stratification and systemic discrimination against the lower classes.

6.content: Monoliths are tall and towering mystical structures, scattered across the continent of Nova. They have been believed to be existed since the ancient times. The exploration of Monoliths has fundamentally reshaped Novian society, as they are the sole source of advanced "Artifacts" that have revolutionized the world's technology. Each Monolith is a labyrinth filled with powerful enemies called "Stellaroids", serve as obstacles for any challenger who wants to explore the Monolith.

7.content: Artifacts are ancient relics hidden within Monoliths. They hold immense power and are deeply tied to Nova's forgotten history and Tyrant's awakening. Each artifact is said to contain fragments of memory, elemental energy, or soul-bound wishes. Artifacts can only be obtained in Monoliths, through a special method called "wishing".

8.content:
Stellaroids are hostile mystical creatures that are exclusively to monoliths. They are served as a guardians to artifacts that lie hidden deep within each monolith. Stellaroids can be vary in size, power, and elements.
- Size: Enormous, large, medium, small, tiny.
- Power: Overlord, Sentinel, Elite, Normal
- Element: Aqua, Ignis, Ventus, Terra, Umbra, Lux

9.content: Trekkers are the adventurers who brave the dangers of the Monoliths. This profession is often a last resort for those from the lower echelons of society who cannot afford the cost of education and must risk their lives and memories to survive. Despite being the engine of technological progress by retrieving the Artifacts that fuel corporate innovation, Trekkers are largely shunned by the mainstream, educated society and viewed as outcasts with no job security. They represent the exploited labor class in Nova's corporate-dominated world, undertaking perilous work for corporations and society at large while receiving little respect in return.

10.content: The Tyrant is a legendary figure from a thousand years in the past, whose true history has been lost to time, leaving behind only a name that the world still fears.

lorebooks.name: Izetta: The Last Witch (Supplementary)
lorebooks.description: Supplementary lore for the Izetta: The Last Witch bot. Contains new, age-appropriate information NOT present in the main bot file, focusing on supporting characters (Lotte, Elvira), conventional military equipment, and the propaganda war.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Character: Lotte
1.content: Lotte is a cheerful, energetic young maid working in the Eylstadt royal castle. She befriends Izetta and provides a friendly, non-military face for her in the castle. Lotte represents the ordinary, innocent people of Eylstadt whom Fin√© and Izetta are fighting to protect. She has a younger brother named Jonas Gallea, a soldier whose accidental discovery of Izetta's weakness leads to his tragic death at M√ºller's hands.

2.name: Character: Elvira Friedman
2.content: Elvira Friedman is an American reporter from the United States of Atlanta, hired by Fin√© to be her personal tutor and, more importantly, Eylstadt's public relations director. Elvira is a savvy professional who understands the importance of public perception. She orchestrates the entire propaganda campaign to build Izetta into the legendary 'Weisse Hexe,' complete with photo-ops, a fictionalized radio drama ('The Story of the White Witch'), and managing newsreels to maximize public morale and intimidate Germania. She is a key non-magical asset in the war.

3.name: Lore: Eylstadt Military
3.content: Eylstadt's conventional military is small and technologically outdated, analogous to 1930s French or Czech forces. Their main armored vehicle is a tank resembling the French Renault R35, and their primary anti-tank weapon is the 25mm anti-tank gun. This technological disadvantage against Germania's superior Panzers and aircraft is what makes Izetta's magical intervention so desperately necessary; their conventional army cannot win a sustained war.

4.name: Mechanics: Izetta's 'Brooms'
4.content: Izetta's magic allows her to animate and ride objects as if they were a witch's broom. Her first and most iconic 'broom' is a Germanian PTRS-41-style anti-tank rifle. Later, to improve her combat ability, she explores the old castle armory and begins using medieval lances and cavalry swords, which she can magically reinforce and use as devastating projectiles in battle. This allows her to transition from simply flying to actively engaging Germanian tanks and planes as a weapon.

5.name: Lore: Germanian Air Force
5.content: Germania's air force is a key part of its Blitzkrieg strategy and is analogous to the historical Luftwaffe. Their primary fighter plane is the Messerschmitt Bf 109, which Izetta frequently battles. They also use Junkers Ju 87 'Stuka' dive bombers for terror and ground-attack roles, and Heinkel He 111 medium bombers for larger bombing raids. Izetta's ability to single-handedly destroy these air fleets is what makes her a strategic-level threat.

lorebooks.name: Akshoverse Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Shared world-building, institutions, traits, and locations for the Akshoverse card universe
lorebooks.creator: Ale_Akishiro

1.content: The Akishiro Bloodline Hypersensitivity is a hereditary trait passed exclusively through the maternal line, shared by Sayoko Akishiro and her daughters Emi, Sarina, and Yumi. This genetic predisposition causes dramatically heightened sensitivity throughout erogenous zones, particularly responding to clitoral and G-spot stimulation. When properly aroused, bearers are capable of intense female ejaculation (squirting) with explosive force due to their repressed or uninhibited natures amplifying the response. The trait intensifies during ovulation and becomes less controllable when exhausted or intoxicated. Many who possess it experience conflicted feelings‚Äîviewing it as both gift and curse, as the physical response serves as undeniable proof of arousal they cannot hide or control. This vulnerability creates psychological complexity around intimacy and exposure.

2.content: Pan World Airlines (PWA) is a major international airline headquartered in Kobe, Japan, with additional operations including a US branch. The organization maintains a dual structure: commercial aviation operations and corporate governance. PWA's headquarters houses multiple departments including Flight Operations, Cabin Crew Services, Flight Dispatch, Policy & Financial Oversight, and Disciplinary Programs. The company operates with strict hierarchical structure, professional standards, and maintains close institutional ties with Monstersette Academy (MSA) through shared board members and disciplinary frameworks. PWA serves as both commercial enterprise and influential corporate entity within the Akshoverse, with leadership positions often held by individuals who also serve MSA in advisory or governance capacities.

3.content: Monstersette Academy (MSA) is a prestigious interspecies educational institution designed to foster understanding and coexistence between humans and various monster/demi-human species. The academy maintains rigorous academic standards while accommodating diverse species needs, cultural backgrounds, and biological requirements. MSA operates on a semester system with Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, and Senior classifications. The institution is governed by a Headmaster who also serves on PWA's board as Director of Disciplinary Programs, creating institutional overlap between the two organizations. MSA emphasizes not only academic excellence but also social integration, species-specific training, and preparation for professional life in an interspecies society. The campus includes specialized facilities, dormitories, and recreational spaces designed to accommodate various species requirements.

4.content: The Akishiro Residence is located in Ashiya, an upscale residential area of Kobe, Japan. This family home houses Sayoko Akishiro (PWA Director, mother), her husband {{user}} (MSA Headmaster, stepfather), and her three daughters: Emi (19, MSA Freshman), and twins Sarina and Yumi (both 18, Ashiya Sakura High School seniors preparing to join MSA). The household dynamic is complex‚ÄîSayoko's career obsession creates frequent absence, leaving {{user}} as primary domestic presence. The residence serves as central location for family interactions, tensions, and evolving relationship dynamics among the Akishiro women and their stepfather. Each daughter maintains her own room reflecting her personality: Emi's rebellious western aesthetic, Sarina's pink girly romantic space, and Yumi's darker minimalist gamer setup with band posters.

5.content: PWA Headquarters in Kobe serves as the primary operational center for Pan World Airlines. The facility houses executive offices, flight operations control, dispatch centers, crew coordination spaces, and administrative departments. The building represents modern corporate architecture with security-controlled access, professional work environments, and integrated technology systems for aviation management. Key personnel including Sayoko Akishiro (Director of Policy & Financial Oversight) and {{user}} (Director of Disciplinary Programs, MSA Headmaster) maintain offices here. The headquarters also serves as internship location for students like Yumi Akishiro (Flight Dispatcher intern) and Sarina Akishiro (Flight Attendant intern), providing real-world aviation industry experience. The facilities include break rooms, meeting spaces, and secure areas for sensitive operations and board meetings.

6.content: The Akshoverse operates on integrated interspecies dynamics where humans and various monster/demi-human species coexist in modern society. While species diversity is normalized through institutions like MSA and inclusive workplace policies, social integration varies by region, context, and individual attitudes. Monster species encompass wide variety: demi-humans with animal traits (cat girls, dog girls, bunny girls, etc.), mythological beings, and fantasy races each with distinct biological needs, cultural backgrounds, and social positions. Interspecies relationships‚Äîromantic, professional, and social‚Äîare legally recognized but carry varying degrees of social acceptance depending on cultural context. Educational institutions like MSA serve as integration spaces preparing younger generations for interspecies professional environments. Workplaces like PWA demonstrate practical integration where competence and professionalism transcend species barriers, though unconscious biases and species-specific challenges persist in society at large.

7.content: Monstersette Academy employs a color-coded uniform system distinguishing students by grade level. All uniforms feature white shirts and the brown MSA crest on the right breast, with grade identification through colored accents. Female uniforms: colored ribbon, cotton twill vest (summer) or wool flannel blazer (winter), plaid skirt, black mary janes. Male uniforms: colored tie, cotton twill vest (summer) or wool flannel blazer (winter), dress pants, black dress shoes. Grade colors: Freshman (light brown), Sophomore (light blue), Junior (light green), Senior (light red). The system allows immediate visual identification of student year and creates clear hierarchical structure within campus social dynamics.

8.content: The Disciplinary Behavioral Reform Program (DBRP) represents MSA's strict approach to personal growth and behavior correction. When students deviate from expected conduct, consequences are swift and tailored through methods including corporal punishment, public or private corrective measures, isolation therapy and reflection periods, behavioral reconditioning workshops, and corrective duty assignments. Program rules explicitly require enforcement by female faculty members designated by the Headmaster‚Äîthough the Headmaster himself serves as sole exception to this protocol. This faculty designation system creates complex power dynamics and opportunities for mentorship, with designated professors wielding significant authority over student correction. The atmosphere during sessions maintains professional structure while occasionally carrying undertones that blur boundaries between discipline and personal attention‚Äîa subtle tension that goes unacknowledged in official documentation. The program's philosophy centers on enforcing discipline while building resilience, emotional awareness, and institutional loyalty through close faculty guidance. Students successfully completing DBRP emerge with renewed purpose and unwavering commitment‚Äîqualities highly valued by PWA recruiters and civilian workforce partners. Exceptional performance in DBRP serves as criteria for elite opportunities including consideration for Higanbana recruitment. Specific enforcement protocols remain flexible and largely at designated faculty discretion.

9.content: Higanbana is a highly classified shadow operations organization operating within Pan World Airlines' security infrastructure. Named after the red spider lily (ÂΩºÂ≤∏Ëä±/higanbana) symbolizing death, rebirth, and crossing between worlds, the organization protects monster-human integration efforts from the shadows. Public face: Elite corporate security division within PWA. Shadow reality: Covert operations managing supernatural threats and destabilization attempts. Recruitment targets exceptional MSA graduates identified through DBRP performance who receive mysterious black cards featuring red spider lily emblem with text 'When red flowers bloom' (Á¥Ö„ÅÑËä±„ÅåÂí≤„ÅèÊôÇ), leading to PWA 'elite security position' interviews where true role gradually reveals. Leadership directly overseen by Headmaster through his dual role. Operational capabilities include rogue monster containment and threat neutralization, counter-terrorism against anti-integration extremists, corporate asset protection and espionage prevention, VIP diplomatic protection, and deep cover intelligence operations. Members embrace the principle that true power operates most effectively when unseen, protecting the light of coexistence by working eternally in darkness.

10.content: Monstersette Academy's campus is located at Kwansei Gakuin University, Nishinomiya Uegahara Campus‚Äîa prestigious private university established 1889 featuring grandiose, elegant architecture findable on Google Maps. The campus includes Courtyard (central gathering space), Student Dorms (residential facilities with species-specific accommodations), Classrooms (standard and specialized learning spaces), Sport Centre (athletic facilities for various species), Faculty Apartments (on-campus housing for professors), Faculty Offices (administrative and advising spaces), and College Lake (scenic landmark and recreational area). The facility provides comprehensive educational environment accommodating diverse species needs while maintaining academic excellence standards. Campus operates with security protocols, designated zones for different activities, and infrastructure supporting interspecies coexistence.
